title: Kinda Disappointing
text: I really wanted to like this video camera. I had planned on cobbling together a 3D printing channel on YouTube but some of the functionality of this is so disappointing. The zoom especially is the worst. It's stepped. There's no smooth zooming in and out, something every still camera I have with video capability can do. How ridiculous is that? You set up a shot and then go to zoom in on the piece you're printing and it zooms, then stops, then zooms, then stops, and does exactly the same zooming out. Video quality is mediocre. Menus are hard to navigate even with the touch screen. The 'night vision' capability is cute and works for a short distance but the quality is horrible. Still images are no better and possibly worse than the video. The wide angle/macro lens is seriously heavy. It does work but there's few elements and the glass is cheap. Macro shots are unimpressive. . , the same description covers just about everything. The external microphone doesn't sound much better than the onboard mic. This might be okay for a kid. Someone just starting out to see if they want to make videos. I'm not really sure who could or would want a camera that's mediocre on all fronts. Nothing stands out as impressive.

title: Well made, great price text: Reading some of the reviews, there have obviously been some issues with this item that I believe where another case being sent instead. Looking today at the Amazon listing, there is something wrong because the "Product Description" is obviously for something else. I reported it.

All I can say is the item picture and the details are correct. I got what I was looking for and it is great for the price. Nice and roomy, very secure with an adustable padded divider that you can move where you want it. Fits my Fuji S series camera with room to spare. You can easily put a couple extra sets of batteries, communication cables or other items and not be crowded. Pretty well made and I like the flap that covers the zipper area. They don't call it weather proof, but I think it would hold up to some rain or snow and keep things dry inside.

Being a camera nut I have tried all kinds of cases from exact fit, hard cases, soft cases and big camera bags. This is a nice size. Not too big and not too small. I've already used it for some of my other cameras too. Main things I'm looking for is protection from dust, dirt, a surprise rain or a little snow, and some moderate protection from bangs and "bruises", and a bit of room for appropriate accessories. This case fits those need quite well. At ~$8 it's hard to imagine finding anything better for that low a price. If you have a Fuji S series or any other similar sized camera, you won't be disappointed.

title: A very nice keyboard with many connection options. text: Typically I stick to higher end gaming keyboards. Mechanical and optical switches are generally my go to. I had never used a keyboard from this brand before so when I was given the chance to grab one, I figured I would see how it stacks up.

So far I'm fairly impressed. I've used some tournament edition keyboards with the smaller form factor from other brands so I knew what I was getting into when it came to the size of the keyboard. All in all, sizing is fine. They key placement and distance between keys works fine. I do run into issues at times where my fingers get lost on the right side of the keyboard. Getting used to that will come in time though. The key response is quick. They are mechanical switches but they do manage to deaden the sound a bit which is nice. The RGB features are basic at best. You have a few settings you can select from and all of it is done directly on the keyboard itself. It has your normal basic modes. It illuminates well though and you can increase/decrease the brightness. The build quality is nice. For being a 75% keyboard, it has some weight to it. I like the fact the keys are labeled for both Mac and PC. I primarily use it on my PC though. The place where it seems to shine is in the connectivity department. I can connect it by bluetooth to numerous devices or I can have it wired. I generally run wired to my main PC and if I need to use it on my MacBook or other devices, I just unplug it from the PC and connect by BT to the other device. It works out nicely.

From a gaming standpoint (which I do a lot of), I'm not certain that I like it as much yet. Emphasis on the "yet". I know it takes some time to become accustomed to a new keyboard. The response and feel. I'm going to continue gaming on it for a while to see if I become more adapted to it. It just feels different than what I'm used to. It most likely has to do with the key spacing more so than anything else.

This is definitely a nice keyboard and I recommend it. I will most likely continue to use it as my daily keyboard for a while longer to see how it holds up over time.

title: Very nice card for basic tasks such as mp3 players and dash cams...
text: Very good card. I have it in a little MP3 player right now, and all my music is playing fine. I can attest to it's performance for more rigorous tasks, but if you're simply looking for some extra storage and doing basic tasks, this will get the job done. It's perfect for dash cams as well. Keep in mind, you lose about 6gb to the OS, so it's only 58 usable GB. No complaints here, 5-Stars!

title: Lovely little smartwatch, would make a great gift text: There are a lot of things I like about this smartwatch. The face is smaller than other smartwatches I've looked at and tried, about 1.09" which is perfect for me. Bigger faces like many smartwatches out there are uncomfortable for me to wear, especially when I'm trying to sleep. The design of the watch is really pretty, and I like how the neutral color goes with many outfits. One thing I do wish is that the watchband was changeable so that I could change it if the band wore out or broke (or if I wanted a different style). Most of the smartwatches with changeable bands are those with the large face, a little disappointing. Battery power is good. I use the smartwatch quite often so I tend to hook it up to the battery charger twice a week. I like how I could choose from a variety of screen displays to fit what my preferences are.

The app this smartwatch uses is great, the Da Fit app. It's super easy to use, you don't have to use Bluetooth to find the watch, you just use the app to find it. I like how it has a variety of physical activity you can choose to monitor, jogging, biking, walking, etc. The sleep feature is pretty good, the biggest detractor is that it only follows typical sleeping hours. It won't work for anyone who sleeps different hours due to working night shift. Hopefully they'll update that in the app someday. The blood pressure feature seems to be pretty accurate to what the doctor tells me my blood pressure is.

Since I really don't want to put out the money for the brand name smartwatches, I am very pleased that I can still enjoy quite a few of the features for a more reasonable price. I'd recommend this watch and it would make a great gift.

Update- After a couple weeks of use, the on/off button on the side of the watch popped off and a spring came out. It's so tiny I'm unable to find it. I wasn't using it excessively, so I'm disappointed that something on the watch would break within weeks of use. It's a really nice watch, and they have great customer care so hopefully my issue is not a common problem.

title: Beautiful picture, tiny eye for the remote control to aim at, works with Denon sound bar & wifi text: I bought this television (I double checked the exact model number to be positive that t I am reviewing the correct one) used at an estate sale in January and it's been used daily in our master bedroom every since. The color and clarity of the picture is simply wonderful. In comparison to our brand new Sceptre 55" 1080p tv in the living room and the 3 year old Samsung in the guest room, this Vizio has the prettiest picture and best refresh rate. The Samsung has the best native sound though without a sound bar enhancement.

This Vizio is our only Smart Television and I have a Firestick on the living room tv. As of today, June 16, 2016, the Amazon app and others are all working just fine through the television's remote control with the direct access buttons. Connecting this tv to our wifi network did take several attempts and I had to update the firmware twice before it would connect and hold the connection for more than 48 hours. (To be honest, I have no idea if the former owner every actually used the internet connection so it may not have been updated before I got it) Since January, I have had no trouble with the connection or streaming. We do have a super fast internet service and a dual band router with this tv as the only thing typically streaming on one band.

My one star deduction is the tiny receiver area for the remote control. If you are using the actual remote rather than a universal one for the cable box, you have to aim directly at the very tiny eye in the far left bottom corner and it can take a couple of tries to hit it just right from across a big room. This drives me nuts when I'm streaming from Amazon Prime and need to pause the show quickly or try to flick through the selections. However, I would totally buy another Vizio tv again in the future if the new ones are as good as this two year old used one has been - I've definitely gotten my hundred fifty dollars worth out of this one.

title: totally hooked. text: Truly what's not to love? This [[ASIN:B015IX72CM HP Sprout Immersive 23" Multi-Touch Computer - 23-s310]] is the perfect desk top computer for your college student. It's also the perfect desktop for any business with a marketing department. I watched this video and was totally hooked. I have been doing PowerPoint presentations for 24 years and this blows it out of the water.

What finally hooked me to it's creative potential at the office was watching two 3 minute videos on YouTube:
"HP Sprout Review" and "Using the Capture Feature on Sprout by HP" - amazing

Hook up was easy as I expected about 20 minutes to unbox everything and less than an hour to get everything running

Now, right now I am not in a financial picture to buy the 3D printer or imaging stand (even tho the prices are not outrageous),but I can still get a designed printed by establishing a free account with HP's 3D printing partner. FYI the Dremel is the highest rated model by '3D Engineer' just go to their sight and search "dremel-idea-builder-review" it gave me a lot of easily understandable information if I decide to go that route. You can also go to the Dremel site '3dprinter dot dremel' the videos there helped me learn a lot about how this 3D printing works. Lastly, I read a informational article at 'makezine' that you can find on the internet "dremel-3d-printer-idea-builder".

Ok, so the next stop on my journey of discovery was HP where I searched 'Sprout'. So I watched the videos and skimmed the tech stuff. WELL worth your time - I truly think it saved me a TON of time. If object design is your thing or you are looking to get your high school or college kid into computer design this desk top will hook them. It's just so creative! One tip when getting started, on the HP site I put a query of "Sprout" in the search engine and got a nice small list of use links PLUS a dedicated SPROUT FORUM for users where HP folks jump in all the time with helpful information and trouble shooting help.

Ok, I really wanted to so how the 3D works so I created a free account with the HP 3D printer partner Sculpteo - it could not be easier. First stop for me was searching the Sculpteo site for '3D Printing Price and Payment Methods' and 'help/#price-calculation'. You can see it doesn't have to be ridiculously expensive - but it can be - the larger the object the bigger the cost. The site is very user friendly and immersive, even if you don't plan to print right off take a look, it is fascinating. A very good article "Sculpteo Opens its 3D Printing Cloud Engine to the Public, BY ANDREW WHEELER MAY 8, 2015" explained how this all works. Also "HP & Sculpteo Partner to 3D Print Directly from Sprout BY DAVIDE SHER AUGUST 3, 2015". Both are most helpful. If you care to read super there are 3 other articles about Sculpteo I read:

Sculpteo: French, Web-Based 3D Printing Service Sculpteo Puts Down Roots in Silicon Valley by Debra Thimmesch | Sep 30, 2015
Staples’ New Sculpteo-Powered Online 3D Printing Service Launches by Scott J Grunewald | Sep 17, 2015

Finally go to you tube and watch a demo "Baig: Here's what HP's new Sprout can do".

I did all this reading and watching while I was waiting for the 55 pound box to arrive and have been playing with it the last 30 days with no complaints at this time. I have only used the presentation creation piece so far but once my college kid gets his hands on it this summer I expect a lot of creativity that should be pretty cool.

title: Good stand with a couple of small issues text: The stand went together easily and works exactly as advertised. I have a 55" monitor weighing 50 pounds on it, and it is rock solid. I can rotate the screen side to side with no concerns. It also gives no indication of tipping over when pushed or pulled.

I really liked the compartmentalization of tools, fasteners, screws and spacers. If there is a screw needed to attach the monitor that is not included, I would be very surprised. Hanging the monitor on the stand can be done alone, but get someone to help if you can.

The one thing that loses this stand a star is the base. I was unable to get all four screws installed because the hole locatins were too far off. The sheet metal is also thin and will easily depress if you put something onto it or lean on it.

Overall, this is a very good choice for a stand.

title: This set is not ergonomically designed; instructions are deceiving; 4 AAA batteries needed text: The writing on the back of the box serves as the instructions and there is no mention that one has to insert 4 AAA batteries to get started. Instead it says to remove packaging material, remove the USB connector from the back of the keyboard and connect to an empty USB on the computer and viola it works. Not true.

First I had to insert 2 AAA batteries into the keyboard and 2 AAA batteries into the mouse. Batteries are NOT included.  Then I removed the USB receiver from the back of the keyboard and inserted it into an empty USB on my computer. I then slid the mouse button into the on position and everything worked.

After using this for a while, I hate this set, particularly the mouse. First of all the keyboard and mouse are not ergonomically designed. They are so flat and low profile that my hands are not at a comfortable angle for typing. I like keyboards that have those lift feet in the back. This keyboard does not. The worst part is the mouse since the hand rests completely flat and not at an angle like most mice. I also find the left and right controls on the mouse very sticky in the sense that they do not respond quickly to my clicks. The roll wheel works wonderfully, however.

In addition to the above, if the mouse is not used continuously, it goes to sleep even though I leave it in the ON position. In order to wake it up, I originally thought I had to turn it on and off (because the instructions do not say what to do). However, if I press down on the wheel, it will wake up for use again.

In summary, this set is functional but not one that works for me due to the low profile of both the keyboard and mouse and the sticky mouse buttons. This review was written using this set.

title: Great concept, when it works. text: [[VIDEOID:3d513e57441130c25fa7c0b6059a91ae]] I really like this concept. It's tiny, and projects an image onto a surface that looks a lot better than I expected. I own some professional grade projectors that I use for work, so to be fair, you can't compare it to a real product like that. For starters, this needs an extremely dark room to work in. Don't even bother during daylight hours unless you have a room with no windows.
But, it comes with Android built in so you're actually able to stream content without plugging anything into it! You can install standard streaming apps, or load up an SD card with content to play, or use the ports behind the rubber gasket if necessary. This thing even does auto keystone if you tilt it, which really surprised and impressed me! And because the back is flat and doesn't block any vents, you can actually lie it down facing the ceiling!
But here's the fatal flaw: The battery isn't great, and when it dies it is very easy to get stuck in this sort of "limbo" state. I managed to twice already boot it without enough battery left to finish booting, and it gets stuck in this trying-to-turn-on mode in which it won't turn off but also won't turn on. Sometimes you can get the projector to show the boot logo if there's enough power for that, but then if it doesn't finish, it shuts off and gets stuck. You can see a little blue light inside, hear something making noise if you hold it to your ear, but it won't finish booting. It also won't TURN OFF. It's stuck like that, the power switch position doesn't matter once this happens. And charging it up won't help either. You need to wait for the battery to totally die (you can see the blue light inside finally turn off) and THEN charge it all the way up, and then it will boot and work correctly.
This is a pretty big flaw in my opinion. This thing really could have used a reset button or way to pull the battery in case this happens. The instructions are pretty terrible too, most of it I had to figure out on my own. But if they can manage to fix that flaw, this is an impressively cool device! I'm going to try and keep it charged and use it on our next camping trip, I really love that you can sit it on it's back and aim the projector at a ceiling! But part of me feels like it is pretty likely to get stuck in this state again.

title: You need to provide your own OPEN END power cord... text: THE GOOD:
---------------
* All 8 ports are gigabit.
* Mainly plastic, but seems sturdy and well made.
* 130w total. Each port has a 30w max. But again, it's 130w total, so you cannot have all 8 ports at 30w each.
* IP65 weatherproof with accessories to mount on wall or poll.
* A template is provided for wall screw locations.
* Built-in surge protection, which is why receptacle does not have ground terminal.

THE BAD:
------------
* No power supply. After contacting seller for advice on power, they've since included a video. However, the video doesn't really help. It's just a video of them plugging in the wires. I just wanted advice on a power supply to buy, or what type of power cord? Gauge thickness? I'm guessing I'm thinking too much, and the thickness doesn't matter, otherwise it would have been mentioned in the manual, or the video they uploaded. So the term you want to search for on Amazon is, "open end power cord." At 12awg, there seems to only be 3 prong cables available. You can still use this, and just ignore the ground wire. I do see a 2 prong version at 14 awg. That's the one I'll get to complete my project. This would be 5-Stars if we didn't have to hunt down our own power, or strip our own power cord. So I'll go 4-Stars.

title: Effective Security System but Tricky to Setup text: After playing with this system for a while we have ended up liking it but it will definitely require devoting time to figuring it out and getting it set up correctly. The set comes with the basics but not enough to cover a full house - door, window and motion.

After finally figuring the system out we have determined that the system does in fact work well and it’s dependable. The app is ok though it could be better with some improvements to usability.

I love that this security system does not require a monthly monitoring contract and provides immediate notifications.

As long as you don’t mind spending the time learning this system you’ll be happy with this product. It’s dependable and provides a layer of security at a reasonable price.

Solid product.

title: Great Dome Camera Junction Box text: In order to properly install some cameras a junction box is required. Depending on the manufacturer of your camera the junction box will differ. This particular one will work with the vast number of dome cameras manufactured by Hikvision - all those that use a 3 hole mounting system.

The box is solidly made and will provide a secure waterproof seal protecting the critical components of your camera.

I have had this box installed for a few months with absolutely no issues. Installation is straight forward and easy.

When ordering double check the mounting system of your dome camera to verify the number of mounting screws - this will save you great frustration caused when trying to mount with the wrong junction box.

This is a great product - one I will purchase again.

title: IMPRESSIVE sound! text: Holy cow! I was NOT expecting the sound from this little speaker to be as good as it is. I own 3 other Bluetooth speakers, one lower price point, one "moderate"/medium, and another that is comparable in price to this unit. None comes close to the sound quality.

It's really unobtrusive looking, almost drab, slightly "retro" in a gunmetal gray with a darker gray screen. A single button surrounded by a ring on top of the unit controls everything that needs controlling (on/off, volume and skip). A thick rubber base keeps it from sliding around on polished tables (like a nightstand, where I'll be keeping this).

It took just over 3 hrs to fully charge using the included wall charger and cable. I paired it with my iPhone -- nothing tricky there -- and proceeded to play music. I'm a conductor/composer and write mostly music for choirs, so that's what I tend to listen to most of the time. First up: the [[ASIN:B0018NQ066 Britten: War Requiem (2 CDs)]] I'm intimately familiar with this work, having performed it three times and conducted rehearsals for it on one occasion. It's one of my "desert island" recordings. It has a huge variety of "sound" from soft/slim orchestration to full out full orchestra and chorus. The LG performed beautifully. NO distortion, every slight nuance was audible. The recording is a quality recording but I've listened to it on all my other wireless speakers as well as my Bose surround wired speaker set up, and the performance of this small LG speaker is impressive. Seriously exceptional performance.

OK, next up, something completely different: Fleetwood Mac [[ASIN:B00B1MHXY2 Rumours]] -- again, virtually flawless performance. All the "bits" of percussion come through crystal clear. It has a decent bass sound, too -- again something I wasn't expecting from a unit in this price point or of this size.

I've been playing this almost non-stop for over 5 hours and it's showing no signs of low battery. The description here says it runs 9 hrs on a single charge; I'm beginning to believe it. Also, it shuts off after 20 minutes if these is no input (Bluetooth mode). You can also turn it off from your smartphone using the app downloaded from the iOS app store (there's an Android version, too).

This has no built-in microphone, so you can't take phone calls on it. It's just a speaker but a VERY good one.

I really can't find anything wrong with this so far. It's really that good.

text: I love this invention!  Works very well, as promised.  The clamp adheres to pretty thick surfaces, but make sure you have enough surface area for the clamp to attach to.  That was my biggest problem in finding a surface for it.  The device holder expands as promised and holds my iPad Air 2.  I love using this to read so that I'm not craning my neck.  Best purchase of the year! The only downside is that the holder can be difficult to maneuver and you either need to be strong or have the help of another person.  You do get used to it over time.

title: Good cooler with cool LED settings text: The AUTENS RGB Laptop Cooling Pad has all the bling of RGB lighting, digital readout, and six cooling fans. It is USB powered and has variable height adjustments for the legs.

It will serve well-enough as a cooler but there are many coolers out there so what might set it apart for a consumer? The honeycomb design and the RGB might be a big factor in one's decision. The buttons on the cooler control the LED light modes (I counted at least 8, plus hold the button to turn off). The power button will power on/off by holding it, but tapping the button while the cooler is on will toggle the number of fans that are turned on. The plus and minus buttons control fan speed. Unfortunately, there are only three speeds available but combine that with the ability to turn some fans off, one can achieve many levels of cooling. For me, it would be all on at full blast because I use my laptop for gaming or video editing.

Overall, great product that should help to keep the GPU temperature low for max performance.

title: Annoying text: So I bought these as add ons meaning we already had a blink system. I checked to see if they were compatible and saw they were with no heads up on any other changes(other than remarkable battery improvements🙄) I can’t tell you how they work because they changed the mount. So now you can only mount to a wall rather than a horizontal surface like your eves or soffit unless you just want to surveil the ground because of the awful range of motion of the mount. You could drill through your siding if you wish, but it sure would be better to drill through a $2 piece of soffit. The original bracket was no gem and I’m sure they got plenty of complaints about the fact that you couldn’t adjust that one in the wall mount config. Why not just supply both or better yet one that’s engineered properly? I know they exist and aren’t very expensive because I just bought a 3 pack of mounts for $18! Unbelievable. Maybe I’ll update when my SECOND ORDER AREIVES so I can finish this project. And just expect to be changing batteries all the time unless your outdoor environment is actually a climate controlled testing area. Thanks a lot Amazon
Oh and they include a bracket extender to increase range of motion, but the picture is it’s physical limit soooo unless the extender is magic it’s still ridiculous.

title: Corsair Memory doesn't work in Lenovo T500 Notebook text: I needed to upgrade my Lenovo T500 to 8gb & ordered the Lenovo recomended specification of memory and went with Corsair product CM3X8GSDKIT1066 XMS3 8 GB PC3-8500 1066Mhz, because Amazon could supply and ship fast.
This memory comes in two 4gb DIMMs. The memory did not boot up at all - I just got the dreaded startup 'beeps' from the BIOS. Turns out one DIMM was absolutely DEAD, the other 4gb DIMM booted up, but quickly failed memory diagnostics.
Thank goodness Amazon took this Corsair crap back!
I ended up buying Crucial memory directly from Crucial, and although slighly more expensive, it worked straight off the bat, passing all diagnostics and memory tests perfectly.

title: Mixed review text: The sun is losing it's strength, and the days are getting shorter, so I purchased this light to help me keep making pendants even in the fall and winter.
It works, sort of. Yes, I read the directions, yes, I applied a thin spread out layer. No matter what I do the sides stay tacky and if they are tacky, I imagine underneath the thin layer isn't quite set either).
It's such a brilliant idea, but for the cost, maybe a UV light from an aquarium store would work better.
I used the magic glos with ZERO complaints in the sun, it works WONDERS, but under this light it's a 50/50 proposition. I even tried leaving them under for extra time and then setting the pendants on their sides so the edges received more directional light, no luck with this lamp.
It works, but hardly perfectly...maybe it's just me, and maybe I can get it to work on something. For now, I'll keep trying, and hope for spring to come again soon.....

title: Poor Design and Slow Copy Rate text: I have always favored Verbatim products, particularly their CD-R Audio platters, so I was excited to try the Clip-It as a storage device. It does indeed work as advertised, but it is not a particularly remarkable product.

As a 4GB storage device, it does well enough but I noticed that the copy rate is somewhat slow. I did a side-by-side comparison with a SanDisk Cruzer stick and found that the SanDisk outperformed the Verbatim by an average of 2 meg/sec. That's an appreciable speed difference! When copying larger files, it means longer waits while the copy completes. For the impatient, this is bad.

I do not like the fact that the contact points are exposed and there is no cover for them. This equates to more opportunities for dirt and oil to contaminate the contacts which may eventually affect reliability.

As a paper clip (this product's other touted function) it performs well for a small number of pages but quickly is outdone when trying to clip together more pages or pages made with thicker paper.

I'm sorry, but I cannot recommend this product. There are other storage solutions that are comparable in price that perform better, have more storage space and are of better design.

title: Very Slow Install Process but Wicked Fast Performance text: We have a router that supports the 802.11ac standard but until we got this router we had no way of connecting to it beyond the 802.11n standard. I was very interested in trying this adapter to see if it really is that much faster. It’s absolutely very fast and has wonderful connection reliability but suffers from a very slow software installation process.

I connected it to a Windows 7 64-bit system and allowed Windows to search for a driver. When that failed (as I assumed it would since this is a new product) I put in the installation CD and started the installer. The process took a surprisingly long time just to install and load the driver, to the point that I considered rebooting the box and starting over. It did finish though and then was ready to connect.

It connected without effort to our 5GHz network and immediately was able to serve up content. Everything seemed to be faster but we were not sure - until my teenage son connected to a Minecraft server and started playing. In addition to a lag-free connection he noticed about a 20% gain in frame rates sustained.

So far I can’t find anything beyond the clunky install that stands out as a negative. This is a fast adapter and it worth the one-time install time if you want fast, reliable connections and have a router that can handle the 802.11ac standard.

title: It works, but no microphone. I still miss my phone's native jack. (not TRRS?) text: For the record: I hate this trend in mobile phones to push us away from a standard 3.5mm jack. I tried to hold onto a phone that had one for as long as I could, but when my Galaxy S10 had to go, I needed an adapter. I love using my high end studio IEMs for music instead of bluetooth or cheap USB-C headphones, and sometimes if my bluetooth earpiece isn't charged, I want to grab my laptop headphones with their in-line mic to do handsfree calls.
Well, I'm happy to say at least I can use this for music with my IEMs and other wired headphones. But I think the jack might be TRS and not TRRS. That means it is missing the extra pin to support the microphone if your headphones have one.
In a nutshell, this will turn a pair of regular stereo (no mic) headphones into a USBC compatible one, but it still isn't as good as a native 3.5mm jack. The real ones used to detect if there was a mic pin attached and give you the ability to use your headphone mic, or use the phone's mic if there wasn't the extra pin. This just defaults to no pin.

title: good functionality, sound is pretty good text: First of all, these work great for me. The design of the silicone flange is a little different from anything I've had before - they sit down into the ear canal, connect at a slightly deeper point. This seems to make a positive difference for me.

The sound is good enough. Not like OMG audiophile - I have the big Sony earmuffs that sound better than these, and some old corded AT's that sound better than the Sonys. And I've used some in a recording studio that had more detail and dimension than anything I've heard before or since. These are a long way off from that. But they are plenty good enough. There is nothing that catches my attention or causes fatigue or makes you want to apply corrective EQ to the source.

These are comfortable. The most comfortable earbuds I've ever had. I sleep in them.

Noise cancelling is like any ANC - good against some noise, less so with other things.

I've never run the batteries all the way down - IDK how long they last.

My one actual annoyance with these is the interface - I always touch the left bud by accident and switch into a mode I don't want. I would prefer it if there was a config utility or something to disable that touch gesture and leave it in ANC full time.

title: Cannot get DRIVER!!!  Do NOT BUY

title: Brought DOWN by a NUT text: So i am building this stand, looks sturdy
1. Got the base mount attached. Check
2. Put in those 2 articulating arms. Check.
3. Monitor bracket. Check.
4. ok. lets lower the monitor by lowering the arm.. o.o cant undo this bolt.. ok one side easy...the other..
5. this hex tool has no torque!....Ugh..now the nut has no grip..and the hex tool is revolving on itself because its nut edges has shaved itself..
6. Repacking..(glad i bought it at amazon)

It looks good, feels good. but this shallow nut and tiny hex tool without torque.. so much potential bought down by this one nut (actually 2..i tried another hex bolt. same issue cannot unwind) by the way i can bench 180lb..so strength was not a issue here)

title: Absolutely fantastic! text: I'm not sure how I lived without this photo booth for so long! Truly!!! My husband and I are obsessed with Legos. But we do not have unlimited space or money, so once we've completed a build, it usually goes up for auction. This photo setup is so quick and easy; and it truly gives us professional looking photos! I think it's made a huge difference with the resales too. I feel like our sets our getting bid up 10, 15 or maybe even 20% more now. It's crazy
It is made of out of sturdy, high quality materials too. Legos are heavy and have sharp edges so I was worried the vinyl would rip easily. But it's holding up beautifully. Plus storage is easy too. Once I'm done taking photos, it stores away nicely under my bed. I really am happy with it.

title: Roomy & Functional text: I have been a big fan of Case Logic for many years, all the way back to when I bought their storage case for my music CDs in the 90's. I still have that case and it's going strong. This messenger bag is no exception. It's built extremely well, with lots of pockets & space for all my camera gear. Everything is well padded. I tend to use a simpler camera for now, I'm not into multiple lenses (yet!) so right now I have room for both my camera & it's simple gear, plus my wallet as well. So I'm able to condense my bags when we go to Disney, which is really nice. When I do decide to start trying out the various lenses, there is plenty of room for them.

So if you're looking for a good camera bag that won't break your budget, stick with Case Logic. I've been very pleased with all their products so far.

Nonetheless, it's a great pack, with lots of pockets, rugged integrity, and very comfortable.

title: Very Good Security System, But There Are Some Flaws text: Security systems are sound investments when protecting your property, and Logitech has entered the market with two interchangeable systems. Both systems are indoor/outdoor, but each comes with either an indoor or an outdoor camera. I have the outdoor unit, though I received an indoor camera as well for testing.

Setup is absurdly easy. From opening the box to having a working system takes roughly 10 minutes, and installing the control software is painless and easy. Once installed and configured you can start working with the system immediately.

The cameras and the software communicate via network, so plan your network topology appropriately. We discovered two important issues, though, when using wireless networking to communicate with the cameras. First, the cameras have a tendency to drop connectivity all at once, and the only recourse is to power them off and back on again. This may be a function of the router we are using, but it still is important to keep in mind. Second, we loaded the software on a laptop and used that for controlling the cameras, and that worked well until the laptop was allowed to hibernate. When it came back, communication with the cameras was lost every time and the cameras needed to be power cycled. Though communication was lost with the cameras, the cameras continued to faithfully record so it could be worse.

The cameras with this system are billed as HD and live up to it. Video is clear and crisp.

The night vision capabilities on the outdoor camera are outstanding. Seeing in the dark is one of this particular camera's strengths. Unfortunately, the indoor camera does not have night vision so recording down a dark hallway will give poor results. This is an unfortunate design decision and hopefully will be addressed later.

The cameras are activated by motion, and the sensitivity is set via a slider in the control software. At the highest sensitivity level, the slightest movement triggers the camera and it starts recording. For an outdoor unit this is too sensitive and the camera will eat through its storage quickly. However, for indoor cameras this is a fine setting when the home is unoccupied for a time.

The cameras can handle larger memory cards but ship with 2GB cards. This is sufficient for starting off but for extended use you'll want a larger memory card.

Because the cameras can be monitored remotely over the internet it is interesting to "tune in" and see what's happening (you can even tap in through your cell phone). It is also useful to transfer the contents of the cards remotely too.

The cameras do not have a battery backup system, so put them on a battery backup if possible. When the power goes out, the eyes go dim.

Logitech has put together a very nice security system that sports a number of nice features. There is room for improvement and there are some flaws, but overall this is a system worth the expense. Consider this system when looking for a security system setup to protect your property.

title: Easy to use, especially once in place
text: While it took me a minute to figure out how to get this in place (I’d recommend doing so when there’s daylight- dark garage made it a little difficult), once I was set up it was so easy! I did end up taking our charging plate completely off before installing this, as keeping it in place prevented me from opening the console area up entirely to have complete access. The face plate that covers the housing box where the usb/hard drive is plugged in is so easy to remove when you want to dump footage onto your computer. The arrow sticker inside makes it easy to get the usb plugged right back in as well. While we only have one Tesla, so I wouldn’t have a need to repurchase, I’d definitely recommend to other Tesla owners trying to find a good solution.

text: It worked great!  I bought a second one and it was still half the price of a single OEM power adapter.

title: Apple-certified, solid performance ... text: I've been using this cable daily for over a week, and I have to say I'm impressed so far.

It's a solid, sturdy cable -- "thicker" than the original, not quite as flexible, but that doesn't bother me. The USB and lightning plugs are securely attached, and it doesn't look like there will be any problems with the cord cover fracturing at either point (I've had that problem with other cables, including the original one that came with an earlier iPhone). The plugs seat securely into my charger and iPhone 5S, too. I have a Case Logic rubber case [[ASIN:B00JMPXGOQ Case Logic CLIPH5-3203 iPhone 5/5s 2-piece Hand Grip - White/Gray]] on my iPhone, and the cord fits just fine.

The cord is 10' long -- that's longer than any of my other cords, and will come in handy for those times when I need to recharge from a plug that's not nearby. This is NOT a "small" cord -- it's going to take up some space while traveling, but to me, it's worth it.

So far, I have noticed no issues at all. It plays nicely with my iPhone, with no hiccups or problems. I'll be traveling with it soon, and will update this review if I notice any issues at all. Otherwise, so far, I'm impressed. I received a sample for review purposes, with no assurance of a positive review. My opinion is based solely on my experience with the product.

We haven't done that, but from what my husband found, it looks like it only allows you to turn the TV on and off or other simple tasks with Google. The remote is user friendly. The sound quality is okay. We haven't decided whether or not we'll get a sound bar for it. Overall, we like it. It's definitely a step up from the older TV.

title: Simply in LOVE text: My first kindle was the Kindle Keyboard and I only used it as a pure reading device: no text to speech, no browser, very little highlighting to dictionary search (latter two options were not thatneasynon the keyboard) and unlike K1 and K2 reviews my key board did not wear out as I rarely used it other than create collection.

Now, after playing with my new 3G-WiFi. With ads - I am simply in love with this pure reading device. It is everything I wanted and here is why I am in love:
1. The touch aspect to create new collection folders was so easy and then moving the books into them was intuitively easy (much easier than the KK,which was frustratingly slow);
2. Set up was real easy as the step by step guide was really helpful;
3. Moving some of my previously purchased books from the cloud to the new kindle was so easy, simple tap multiple books and when you switch back to the home page, they were downloaded really fast! Wow. I was worried this transfer was going to be a painful process, woohoo - so not the case.
4. Light adjustment was easy and reading in a dark room was easy and no eye strain!!! Super whoop whoop. (update: I am in double of getting sleepless nights! The reading in the dark was sooo comfortable, and I couldn't stop reading! Wow. Love it).
5. The touch screen was so easy to use and very intuitive and I do like the fonts selection!
6. Now has a little clock on top right wephen you are on the home page so I can check when to start cooking dinner!
7. There is finally a password (numbers only) at last to protect access to your kindle!!!
8. Great size and easy to hold in one hand and easy to touch and move the page, which was nice and responsive.
9. Shop kindle is the same as is the location of the ads, which I do not find intrusive as it only appears when your screen is asleep and not when you are reading! Had no issue with it with my KK, and no issue with the ads now!
10. I upgraded to the 3G- i had to goto the lobby that would prompt the 3G- nice!!! My KK only had wifi.
11. Extra pixel, you certainly notice it against the KK! But your brain and yes adjust very quickly so it may seem like nothing, but relatively, the improvement is noticeable!

Yes, I understand why some people are not happy with the light projection, as there are four lights projected from the bottom of the screen, which does create a little teeny weeny shadow. It is not so annoying at all, not for me and it Does not interrupt the reading experience since the wee shadow do not affect the text. Just my experience.

All round for me, this kindle is everything I want in a kindle! I am soooooooo happy and yes, the upgrade, for me, from a KK was worth it. I am in love!

I thought the technology would've improved that a 800 dollar new laptop would perform better then a 4 year old 1200 dollar computer. I was wrong. I averaged 60 fps with major lag spikes in teamfights in League of legends a 10+ year old game. I expected 120+ with the screen at 144hz. But it wasn't the screen holding me back it was the gpu, I guess. Also had poor performance in Dota 2. I wouldn't recommend this laptop. Also the volume on the speakers never rose over 50% it seemed. I couldn't hear the other players voices in dota 2 with everything on max. It was the computer, my note 20 is faster, clearer, battery stronger, and a smoother experience in League of Legend wild rift. So if you don't mind dying everytime there are more the 1 thing going on like single player games, go ahead and get this. But if you want to be frustrated every time you play, go ahead and get this "gaming" laptop. I didn't even try any of the AAA games, so maybe it's just the games I play. SMITE, DOTA 2 LOL PALADINS

title: Bright & Clear Images
text: The Epson Home Cinema 2100 projector is an upgrade for our basement family room. We had a ViewSonic projector prior to this so that is what I am using for comparison. The Epson one is significantly brighter than the VS one. The room doesn't have to be completely darkened to get a good image. We also use this with a real movie screen as opposed to a painted wall.  Images are also nice and clear.  We've mounted it on a homemade platform that my husband constructed. It has a decent speaker built in, but for movie watching, it's definitely better to have it connected to a home theater sound system. It's also much quieter than the View Sonic in terms of the fan cooling noise. The ViewSonic's noisy fan is the reason we acquired the older projector from my husband's boss.  The remote is easy to navigate.  There was no special set up was required. Watching movies with a projector really make movie nights more fun!

title: Defective Immediately text: There is a great feature of this TV, as it has the Google Voice Assistant built in. You can either access the Voice Assistant by holding the microphone button down on the remote control, where the remote's mic sends your command to the TV, or by simply (and more conveniently) speaking out loud, saying the Google Wake Words, and then the TV's internal microphone hears you and Google responds. You can control a lot of features just with your voice, without having to touch the remote control. This includes turning the TV off, or muting the sound, or lowering or raising the volume, etc.

However, on the TV I received, the internal microphone is dead. Or, it's some other hardware failure. Yes, the microphone switch is set to the ON position. Yes, the setting to allow my voice to control the TV is on. Yes, 2 separate Sony tech support reps accessed my TV via the Remote Access feature and went through everything. It was extensive. Yes, the TV has all the updates, and a factory reset was done. The TV's microphone will not respond at all to the Hey Google or OK Google command.

title: Works really well
text: Works really good and we have a big house.

title: Only works fully on one of three devices I tried but has a nice stereo sound when it works text: I tried this speaker on the Google Nexus 7, iPhone 5, and iPad 3.

- With the Google Nexus 7 the speaker would only work very well while on Bluetooth connected to Rock Out (the speaker's Bluetooth). If I connected the cable to the headset port, the sound only came out as a whisper. I verified that the volume was on max on both the speaker and the Nexus 7. The documentation says "Know that when you're hardwired in for sound, the external controls are optimized for Apple devices." This explains why my Nexus 7 does not work when wired to the speaker.

- With the iPad 3, I was able to connect via the headset port and via Bluetooth without any problems and the sound was adequate but not fantastic even on the highest volume.

- With the iPhone 5, I was only able to connect via the headset port. When we connected via Bluetooth no sound would come out of the device. My boyfriend and I tried several times (about 6 times). We tried while on both the cellular network and also on my wi-fi network and were able to connect to Rock Out but never could get the sound to work. There was one time where it disconnected itself when we went back to look but except for that once, it remained connected throughout. There's a Bluetooth Memory reset by turning the speaker on, pressing and holding the power button for 10 seconds and then pairing the device with the iPhone. I verified that the unit was also fully charged. As long as I was connected via the headset cable I could answer calls by pressing the play button on the unit. However, no matter what my boyfriend and I did, we could not get Bluetooth to work on the iPhone 5.

The R0S2 is definitely rugged and when it works the sounds is adequate to very good. Only my boyfriend's iPhone 5 with the OtterBox installed would fit into the case of the unit for storage. Anything larger than this won't fit, which means the device has to be hanging off the unit if Bluetooth does not work or Bluetooth will have to be used so that the case can remain zippered up.

Based on my measurements, any item that is 5-1/2 inches wide by 2-3/4 inches tall by 1/2 inch thick should fit inside the case. I also weighed the case and it was almost one pound (15.7 ounces). For me it is not worth it to carry an extra pound of gear backpacking. Also, unless one is kayaking, biking, or out in the sun, the unit does not charge in the shade and according to the directions, it takes 8 hours to fully charge via solar power.

As long as there was some sun, I noticed the unit charging. As per the directions, it will take about 8 hours to solar charge. I charged mine in about 2 hours using my computer's USB port. The documentation says the run time is 10 hours but after almost two hours of use, I noticed only 2 bars on the charge when I plugged it back in for recharging.

The unit can be daisy chained to other Rock Out speakers for more sound. The unit has a 3.5 mm audio jack (line-level) and a 5V USB charging cord. According to the box, the speakers are 3W. The battery is a Lithium-ion, 3.7V, 800 mAh, 3Wh.

Another thing I noticed is that because the case bottom is not totally flat, the speaker has to be balanced to sit upright without falling over. Every time I tried it either fell forward or back so I had to lean it against something. Of course if it is secured to backpack or bicycle basket this is a non-issue.

In summary, I love the rugged case and think the sound is great to just okay depending on the item or material being played or the device it is paired with. I like that movies can be paused just by pressing the pause button on the speaker or that I can go to the next song by pressing the advance button. I have a hard time believing that backpackers will want to carry this almost one-pound speaker with them especially if hiking in the woods where there is usually no sun to charge the unit. Even though the bungee cord around the outside of the unit is thin, it has some clip hooks attached for fastening to a backpack or bicycle basket that should keep it secure. I like the olive green color because it is camouflaged for nature as it was designed to take backpacking. I give this 2.6 stars and recommend with reservations because the unit does not always work with the headset jack or on Bluetooth. Whether it is going to work or not apparently depends on the unit being connected to the device. When it works it's great; when it doesn't it is disappointing. I think the current price of $129.99 is also a bit steep.

UPDATE Dec 20, 2014

March 10, 2017 - Today I tried again to pair this with my [[ASIN:B00O0M750W HP OMEN 15-5010nr Gaming Notebook with Beats Audio]] and I was finally able to get it to work where a couple of years ago no sound came out of the speaker. The unit was fully charged as usual. Pairing seems to be hit or miss.

title: Number keys do not work on Note 9 or Fire Tablet text: What a disappointment. The keyboard is well made but it does not work correctly. I see other reviews with the same problem as I have. The number keys on the top row do not type numbers (0-9) . I have tried this on multiple devices (Note 9 and Fire Tablet). Also as other users said ' key combinations will frustrate touch typists' the layout is unconventional so some common keys require to press the Fn button instead of the shift. Also, keys for Android are missing, there is not Apps keys so you need to use your finger on the device to swipe to your apps screen. There should really be an app to deal with the key assignment and trackpad speed.

Well, it's going back in the box to Amazon Returns. This keyboard needs a lot of improvements.

title: Works perfectly for my uses text: This is not the best adapter in the world, but I knew that going in. I use mine to transform a 3.5mm jack in a [[ASIN:B004VQDAQK Powerwerks PW50 Portable PA System]] into a third channel and this adapter works perfectly for that.

Note that I am not expecting stereo signals and have not tested this adapter to ensure that it supports that function.

Reading over other reviews complaining about flimsy construction and myriad other problems leads me to conclude that the adapter I received is a new and improved version. It's not particularly flimsy and both sides mate with their respective plugs with no tolerance issues.

Since I am using this to reclaim a channel on a relatively inexpensive powered mixer I cannot comment on signal quality. It's not especially noisy, but on the other hand if I were using this to enjoy music through headphones I would have probably purchased a higher quality adapter.

Bottom line: I am pleased with this adapter, but note that you do get what you pay for. If you want a quick fix like for what I am using mine for it's a bargain. If you want an adapter for high end stereo gear you may want to consider a higher end adapter like the [[ASIN:B0002E51CQ Planet Waves 1/8 Inch Female Stereo to 1/4 Inch Male Stereo Adapter]].

title: Happy I found the right size batterys
text: Phones are working!

title: They don't last
text: These cords seemed okay at first. Now, they are garbage. My iphone always pops a warning that "this device is not recognized" when you plug them into the phone. Or, while it is charging, the phone keeps beeping like the cords don't fit the port right. All 4 cords are in the garbage now. Spend more money, and buy good cords.

title: the tv i needed it for is not a smart tv and only has one port so i purchased ...
text: Works when it wants to. My daughter brought me a Apple tv, the tv i needed it for is not a smart tv and only has one port so i purchased this so i wouldn't have to unplug the tv post everytime i wanted to use my Apple tv, the port will work for a few minutes than get fuzzy. Just a piece of junk!

title: HDMI that works
text: I was having problems with the picture dropping off the screen but not with sound. I then was told I needed a high speed HDMI and purchased these from the positive reviews. So far, I am happy to report that the problem has not come back. I am quite happy about that!

title: Great value
text: Was a Christmas gift for our son. Very pleased with shipping/packaging as there was no damage. Pleasantly surprised due it was to slightly larger than expected making it a great value for the money paid.

title: Five Stars
text: So fun! My firefighter husband loved it!

title: Works great and great product!
text: I bought this because I purchased one of the cheaper adapters that only lasted about 2 weeks. First off, this product was packaged like an OEM product and arrived very quickly.  Most off-brand power supplies (such as the one I bought prior to this one) are built with super cheap materials and you can definitely tell this by the weight.  This adapter is very well built and even feels heavier than the original.  The blue LED light is great for showing that the adapter is working but is a tad bright.  The OEM adapter did not have an indicator light.  Working great so far as of 12/14/2017 and you can't beat the savings!

title: Weak text: The fan power is quite weak and doesn’t serve the purpose. I was using as a replacement for an outdoor Christmas decoration fan where the other fan died after a few years. This was the same specs as the fan it was replacing and. The air generated made it look like a dying Christmas tree.
That was my purpose, maybe it would work in other applications but again the specs lined up with the other fan it was replacing.

title: Works as advertised & setup was very easy, no app required text: I had this set up & working in a few minutes. Everything was through my phone's wifi & browser, I didn't have to download any apps or create a new account or password (except the password for the new wifi signal). My goal was to extend my wifi to a pool house that is about 100' from the nearest repeater. After installing this extender I was able to stream to a Fire Stick through 2 exterior walls & inside the pool house seamlessly
The extender has a light that is blue when the feed signal is strong & red when it is weak. I placed the extender a little over halfway to the pool house & even though the light is red, I had no trouble streaming. The extender also has a WPS setup that I didn't use.
The last wifi extender I had was a large tombstone style that had a wall adapter & cord & took up space. precious horizontal space This one is so compact & well laid out that it just hangs on the outlet & even leaves the other plug available.

title: Strong  USB-C Cables
text: Brought for my USB-C Cable extension and this cables are nice and they and big enough.

title: Smaller than expected text: Nice, but much smaller than I was expecting.

I should have reviewed measurements first as the photo makes it look bigger

Nothing wrong with it and good construction

title: Keeps my iPad charged while controlling my Yamaha P-115 keyboard text: I purchased this to power my iPad Pro while using it as a controller for my [[ASIN:B00UHBGE7A Yamaha P115 88-Key Weighted Action Digital Piano]]. I had been using the [[ASIN:B014VGHG0U Apple MD821AM/A Lightning to USB Camera Adapter]], but while it worked as an interface to my piano, the iPad's battery would drain too quickly. This adapter solved that problem.

You can power from a wall charging unit or one of the many external battery packs on the market, while simultaneously controlling your Yamaha P-115. The iPad stays charged, and that makes this adapter a godsend to me.

Note: I have NOT tried connecting drives, or other USB devices to my iPad using this adapter, so cannot comment one way or the other about those scenarios.

title: So far so good text: Used 10 of these discs so far. Perfect.

Can't figure out why Amazon shipped these in a bubble bag. Spindle/case were shattered and the bag was filled with discs and plastic debris. No matter. These discs are working perfectly.

title: Sturdy
text: I’ve had other cases, cute, flexible, fun, but none have held up like this one. The others broke down easy and never seemed to last long. This case; well I will buy another from this company if and when i need. Thanks. Great product!

title: Works Perfectly
text: I am using these in my Reolink Lumus cameras. The cameras recognized these right away. Playback is fast. I really like that these cards include the full-size SD-Card adapter.

title: Beautiful. text: I've been wanting one of these. Arms are rad and make productivity fun. There are plenty for monitors, but laptops and tablets? Yes, please.

The instructions were very clear, but mine were missing nuts to keep the tablet/laptop stand in place. I contacted their customer service and was shipped the missing pieces straight away. I received them in a few days so I didn't wait long at all.

Once everything was built, I used it straightaway for an iPad. Some tightening is required for each device it holds, but at least I know the device will be secure when it's being held. The same stand is used for putting whatever you want on it; there are adjustable arms on the stand to keep the device secure. My kid was able to maneuver the arm to record their how-to videos.

Some parts are plastic, but everything feels solid. The plastic parts are white while the rest are silver. It's a little clashing; maybe the plastic parts would've been better in gray.

title: Excellent Buy!
text: My son uses these headphones with his iPhone. They work great and are comfortable. Would definitely buy again!

title: Solid text: Very well built, if I had the time I'd set up a test (e.g. impedance, etc.)...but would def. buy again.

Because I didn't know which one I'd like the best, I bought this, Raptor GRCABF...Coupler, and the KnuKonceptz Krystal...Coupler Silver.

All are great, I can't decide which is nicest. Sorry if this doesn't help you choose just one, but I don't think you can go wrong with either of the three.
